subject: Re: [junit] Is the error cos of Classpath or my Program??
msgSnippet: the current working directory needs to be in the classpath. this is done usually by putting . (period) in the classpath. BOL, vivek srinivasan
messageBody:
the current working directory needs to be in the classpath. this is done usually by putting "." (period) in the classpath.
BOL,
vivek srinivasan <wvuvivek@...> wrote:Hi all,
I am trying to test a fibonacci series.
I have 2 programs
1.Fibonacci.java whichdoes the fibonnaci calculation

public class Fibonacci {
int compute (int n) {
if (n<2) return n;//bug; should be "1"
else return compute(n-1)+compute(n-2);
}

}
2. TestFibonacci.java which is the test program
import junit.framework.*;

public class TestFibonacci extends TestCase {
Fibonacci f;

public TestFibonacci(String name) {
super(name);
}

public void setUp(){
f=new Fibonacci();
}

public static Test suite() {
return new TestSuite(TestFibonacci.class);
}

public void test1() {
assertTrue(f.compute(1)==1);
}

public void test2() {
assertTrue(f.compute(4)==5);
}
//starte text interface und lass die tests laufen.
public static void main(String args[]) {
junit.textui.TestRunner.run(suite());
}

}

I complile the programs in the following order
1.javac Fibonacci.java
2. javac -classpath c:\junit\junit3.8\junit.jar
TestFibonacci.java
But, I get the following errors
*******************************************************
TestFibonacci.java:4: cannot resolve symbol
symbol : class Fibonacci
location: class TestFibonacci
Fibonacci f;
^
TestFibonacci.java:11: cannot resolve symbol
symbol : class Fibonacci
location: class TestFibonacci
f=new Fibonacci();
^
2 errors
*******************************************************

I havenoclueas towhat these erros are?? Both the
programs are in the same directory. IS something wrong
with the way i am compiling the program or should
Fibonacci.java have a main Function?? I am newto this
junit stuff. PLease help me get going with my first
test case.

Thank you in advance.
Regards,
Vivek
